entry.title: tayaw kinpun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the traditional shampoo tayaw kinpun (pictured) has been used by successive Burmese kings to wash their hair ritually to cast away evil, and augment their powers?

entry.title: Roland Jefferson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Roland Jefferson, the first African-American botanist to work at the U.S. National Arboretum, helped preserve the famous flowering cherry trees in Washington, D.C.?

entry.title: Gandhi's statue in the Indian parliament (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gandhi's statue in the Indian parliament is frequently used as a protest site by members of parliament?

entry.title: Rogers Covey-Crump (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rogers Covey-Crump, once the high tenor of the Hilliard Ensemble, is known as a leading Evangelist in Bach's Passions?

entry.title: a New York state TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after the tower of a New York state TV station was toppled by Hurricane Hazel, it did not return to the air for more than 18 months?

entry.title: Trevor Hill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1944, at the age of 18, Trevor Hill was responsible for broadcasting Eisenhower's D-Day announcement of the Normandy landings?

entry.title: Gleaners Food Bank (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Gleaners Food Bank has served more than 700 million pounds (320 million kg) of food in Indiana?

entry.title: AMTD Digital (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that AMTD Digital had a market value greater than the Coca-Cola Company, Costco or McDonald's after its stock price rose 21,000 percent in a matter of days?
